alert.note: Alert for Pueblo (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 22 at 3:27AM MDT until June 23 at 2:45AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: .Heavy rains have caused widespread flooding in the Fountain area as well as southern El Paso and northern Pueblo Counties. Flooding will continue until the water has a chance to recede. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of east central Colorado and southeast Colorado, including the following counties, in east central Colorado, El Paso. In southeast Colorado, Pueblo. * WHEN...Until 600 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 325 AM MDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area, especially in and around the town of Fountain. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fountain, Hanover, Pinon, Security-Widefield, Security, and Fort Carson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
